text: heavy one today I'm making a very
special dessert it's a different ice
cream
the dish is sounds really contradicting
right how do you keep the ice cream
still co and firm when you put it into
the hot oil like you will try at home to
see whether is still possible you will
need some sandwich bread you want to
trim up the rim and then use a rolling
pin to roll it flat then place one slice
of sandwich bread on a piece of plastic
wrap
take one scoop of ice cream and place in
the center then place another piece of
sandwich bread on top gather the
outsides of the plastic wrap give it a
little twist and shape it into a nice
Bowl you can also use aluminum foil to
shape the ball then put it in the
freezer for at least 6 hours to get firm
now prepare three small balls in a row 1
bowl of bread crumbs I'm using panko or
Japanese bread crumbs crack one egg in
another bowl and mix well and the third
bowl filled with all-purpose flour
heat a generous amount of oil in a small
pan and lid two to three inches high
when you stand a chopstick in the center
and see bubbles appear rounded thus one
is hot enough now keep the heat to
medium then take the ice cream balls out
of the fridge remove the wrap quickly
roll it in the UH purpose flour Bowl to
coat evenly then dip it into the beaten
egg bowl and then again roll it into the
bread crumbs
then gently drop the ball into the hot
oil and fry for just about 30 seconds
until the whole surface of the ball turn
golden brown on the outside then take it
out and gently tap on a piece of paper
towel to rip off the excess oil you've
got to do everything really fast before
the ice cream melt while the outside is
really golden and crispy let's see how
the inside look at that
the ice cream is too firm and cold like
magic is the contrast of hot and cold
crispy on the outside but melting soft
on the inside that makes this dessert so
interesting I hope you're gonna give it
a try and let me know what you think
don't forget to share with me a photo of
your deep-fried ice cream so I can see
how it turns out just like a photo and
share it with public on instagram with
hashtag heron recipes thank you so much
for watching bye bye
